jobTitle: Engineering Manager, Data Science & Algorithm Development (DSP)
jobDescription: Careers That Change LivesThis role will be responsible for the management of an R&D; group responsible for data analytics and algorithm development pertaining to Medtronic’s glucose sensors. In this role, the individual will help establish and drive the strategic direction of the team, and will be responsible for all analytics efforts spanning research through to development. A successful candidate will have management experience (people or program) and sufficient knowledge of signal processing methodologies and software development tools so as to make informed technical decisions. Preference will be given to candidates with direct experience in the software and algorithm development lifecycle.DiabetesThe Diabetes Group is working with the global community to change the way people manage diabetes. Together, we will transform diabetes care by expanding access, integrating care, and improving outcomes; so people with diabetes can enjoy greater freedom and better health.A Day in the Life• You will manage a technical team with focus on algorithms and data analytics. Establish a structure for this team that can address organizational needs• You will lead algorithm development projects from investigation through to productization• We will ask that you actively search for best-in-class technologies and develop innovation roadmap• Identify and implement systems and tools to facilitate the algorithm development life cycle• Collaborate closely with other managers and project leads and establish infrastructure to support cross-functional analytics needs• Participate in meetings and share technical information and "best-practices” across the Sensor R&D; organization• Develop individuals assigned to the team, promote engagement and ensure job satisfaction of individual team membersMust Have: Minimum Requirements To be considered for this role, please ensure the minimum requirements are evident on your resume.• Bachelor’s or advanced degree in Electrical engineering, Computer engineering, Computer science, or related discipline and 5 years of industry experience OR • Masters Degree in Electrical Engineering, Computer Engineering, Computer Science or Related Discipline and3 years of industry experience • Industry experience in program management, people management or in a technical lead position • Signal processing & analytics experience in industry settingNice to Have• Direct people management experience• Experience in a regulated industry and exposure to regulatory submissions; we’d love if you had experience in biosensor signal processing• Experience interacting with a multi-disciplinary, cross-functional team• Direct experience working with and implementing advanced analytics and algorithm methodologies• Demonstrated ability to work and lead within a team-based project environment• Ability to effectively communicate technical information through presentation and through the preparation of technical documentation and/or manuscripts• Ability to read, analyze, and interpret common scientific and technical journalsAbout MedtronicTogether, we can change healthcare worldwide.
